net.sf.sprockets.sql

Class SQLite

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.sprockets.sql.SQLite

  • public class SQLite
extends Object
    Utility methods for working with SQLite.
    Since:
    2.2.0

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static String alias_(String column)
      Get a result column that aliases the column to the same name, except with underscores replacing dots.

      Get a result column that aliases the column to the same name without the table prefix.

      Get the name that the column was aliased to.

      Get UTC date and time for now, in the format YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss.

      Get UTC date and time for the milliseconds since the epoch, in the format YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss.

      Get a result column for the squared distance from the row coordinates to the supplied coordinates.

      Get an aliased result column that converts the datetime column value to epoch milliseconds.

      • alias

        public static String alias(String column)
        Get a result column that aliases the column to the same name without the table prefix.
        Returns:
        e.g. table.column AS column

        public static String datetime()
        Get UTC date and time for now, in the format YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss.

        Get UTC date and time for the milliseconds since the epoch, in the format YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss.

      • millis

        public static String millis(String column)
        Get an aliased result column that converts the datetime column value to epoch milliseconds.

      • normalise

        public static String normalise(String s)
        Remove diacritics from the string and convert it to upper case.

      • distance

        public static String distance(String latitudeColumn,
              String longitudeColumn,
              String latitudeCosineColumn,
              double latitude,
              double longitude,
              MeasureUnit unit,
              String alias)
        Get a result column for the squared distance from the row coordinates to the supplied coordinates. SQLite doesn't have a square root core function, so this must be applied in Java when reading the result column value.
        Parameters:
        latitudeCosineColumn - see Geos.cos(double)
        unit - KILOMETER or MILE
        alias - result column name
